Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • Display

  • public class Display
extends java.lang.Object
    class Display

    Used to create a window and display stuff to the screen.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • ALLOWRESIZE

        public static final boolean ALLOWRESIZE
        If the window is resizeable.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FPS

        public static final int FPS
        The FPS this window will try to run at.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • w

        public static Display.WindowSize w
        The size of the window, contained within a Display.WindowSize, an inner-class of Display. If ALLOWRESIZE is true, then the window's size can change, and this will update and reflect that in real time. (Just before every frame is rendered)

      • WINDOWHEIGHT

        public static final int WINDOWHEIGHT
        The height of the window to create.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • windowName

        public final java.lang.String windowName

      • WINDOWWIDTH

        public static final int WINDOWWIDTH
        The width of the window to create.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Display

        public Display(java.lang.String windowName,
               DisplayableWindow toDisplayFirst)
        Constructor for Display

        Creates a new Display Object with the given DisplayableWindow object, and will call it to render stuff.

        Parameters:
        toDisplayFirst - The DisplayableWindow that will be displayed first.

    • Method Detail

      • disableTransparency

        protected static void disableTransparency()
        After running disableTransparency, transparent objects can no longer be drawn.

        Use enableTransparency() again to reenable it.

      • doCircle

        public static void doCircle(double xPos,
                            double yPos,
                            double radius,
                            boolean fill)
        Draws a circle, using coordinates from the origin.
        Parameters:
        xPos - Center of the circle's X coordinate.
        yPos - Center of the circle's Y coordinate.
        radius - Radius of the Circle
        fill - If the circle should be filled.

      • doPointCart

        public static void doPointCart(double x,
                               double y)
        Adds a point to the screen, using cartesian coordinates.

        Coordinates: (0,0) maps to the center of the screen. Positive x is to the right from the center. Positive y is upward from the center.

      • doPointOr

        public static void doPointOr(double x,
                             double y)
        Adds a point to the screen, using coordinates from the origin.

        Coordinates: (0,0) (origin) maps to the top left corner of the screen. Positive x is to the right from the origin. Positive y is downward from the origin.

      • drawLineOr

        public static void drawLineOr(java.awt.Point start,
                              java.awt.Point end)
        Draws a line, using coordinates from the origin.
        Parameters:
        start - The start location of the line, using coordinates from the origin.
        end - The end location of the line, using coordinates from the origin.

      • drawRectangleOr

        public static void drawRectangleOr(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int width,
                                   int height,
                                   boolean fill)
        Draws an optionally filled rectangle, using coordinates from the origin.
        Parameters:
        x - Center of the rectangle's X coordinate.
        y - Center of the rectangle's Y coordinate.
        width - The width of the rectangle.
        height - The height of the rectangle.
        fill - If the rectangle should be filled.

      • enableTransparency

        protected static void enableTransparency()
        After running enableTransparency, transparent objects can be drawn.

        Please use disableTransparency() afterwards to disable it.

      • getCursorLocationCartesian

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getCursorLocationCartesian(Display.WindowSize w)
        Gets the cursor's location, using coordinates from the origin.
        Parameters:
        w - the size of the window, to adjust the cursor's location from ratios to the exact values.
        Returns:
        The cursor's location in a Point2D.Double.

      • getCursorLocationOrigin

        public static java.awt.Point getCursorLocationOrigin(Display.WindowSize w)
        Gets the cursor's location, using coordinates from the origin.
        Parameters:
        w - the size of the window, to adjust the cursor's location from ratios to the exact values.
        Returns:
        The cursor's location in a Point.

      • getWindowSize

        public static Display.WindowSize getWindowSize()
        Gets the size of the window, and returns it as a Display.WindowSize.
        Returns:
        the size of the window as a Display.WindowSize.

      • hsb4ToColor

        public static java.awt.Color hsb4ToColor(int hue,
                                         int saturation,
                                         int brightness,
                                         int alpha)
        Converts the HSBA color to a Color object.
        Parameters:
        hue - A value between 0 and 359 for the hue component of the color.
        saturation - A value between 0 and 100 for the saturation component of the color.
        brightness - A value between 0 and 100 for the brightness component of the color.
        alpha - A value between 0 and 255 for the alpha component of the color. Transparency, with 0 being fully transparent and 255 being opaque.

      • normalizeDouble

        public static double normalizeDouble(double value,
                                     double min,
                                     double max)
        Restricts an double value into a given range.
        Parameters:
        value - The given value to normalize.
        min - The lower bound of the range.
        max - The upper bound of the range.
        Returns:
        the value normalized into the given range.

      • normalizeInt

        public static int normalizeInt(int value,
                               int min,
                               int max)
        Restricts an integer value into a given range.
        Parameters:
        value - The given value to normalize.
        min - The lower bound of the range.
        max - The upper bound of the range.
        Returns:
        the value normalized into the given range.

      • run

        public void run()
        Opens the window, and starts it's render loop.

        public static void setColor3(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the color to draw without transparency.
        Parameters:

      • setColor3

        public static void setColor3(int r,
                             int g,
                             int b)
        Sets the color to draw without transparency.
        Parameters:
        r - A value between 0 and 255 for the red component of the color.
        g - A value between 0 and 255 for the green component of the color.
        b - A value between 0 and 255 for the blue component of the color.

      • setColor4

        public static void setColor4(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the color to draw with transparency.
        Parameters:
        c - The Color object to set the color to, including the transparency component.

      • setColor4

        public static void setColor4(java.awt.Color c,
                             int a)
        Sets the color to draw with transparency.
        Parameters:
        c - The Color object to set the color to.
        a - A value between 0 and 255 for the alpha component of the color. Transparency, with 0 being fully transparent and 255 being opaque.

      • setColor4

        public static void setColor4(int r,
                             int g,
                             int b,
                             int a)
        Sets the color to draw without transparency.
        Parameters:
        r - A value between 0 and 255 for the red component of the color.
        g - A value between 0 and 255 for the green component of the color.
        b - A value between 0 and 255 for the blue component of the color.
        a - A value between 0 and 255 for the alpha component of the color. Transparency, with 0 being fully transparent and 255 being opaque.

        saturation - A value between 0 and 100 for the saturation component of the color.
        brightness - A value between 0 and 100 for the brightness component of the color.

      • setColorHSB4

        public static void setColorHSB4(int hue,
                                int saturation,
                                int brightness,
                                int alpha)
        Sets the color to draw without transparency.
        Parameters:
        hue - A value between 0 and 359 for the hue component of the color.
        saturation - A value between 0 and 100 for the saturation component of the color.
        brightness - A value between 0 and 100 for the brightness component of the color.
        alpha - A value between 0 and 255 for the alpha component of the color. Transparency, with 0 being fully transparent and 255 being opaque.
